author: Devesh K
text:
Expediting the probe into the money-laundering case against Pune-based race horse owner Hasan Ali Khan, the Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday conducted searches on the premises of the accused and his accomplices in six cities.

The agency had registered the case under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act in 2011 and Hasan Ali was arrested soon after. He was in judicial custody till August last year when the Bombay High Court granted him bail.

In 2011, the ED also arrested Kashinath Tapuriah, a Kolkata-based businessman and Ali’s alleged accomplice.

The case tops the list of cases being monitored by the Special Investigation Team on Black Money that was set up by the Central government in 2014 pursuant to a Supreme Court directive. Ali’s name figures in the SIT’s terms of references. Based on fresh leads, the ED teams, comprising over 30 officials, conducted searches in Delhi, Gurgaon, Bengaluru, Mumbai, Pune and Kolkata.

Multiple cases

Ali was also investigated by the Income-Tax Department, the Economic Offences Wing of the Mumbai Police and the other sister agencies for suspected violations under the Passport Act and for alleged involvement in generating undeclared income running into thousands of crores and stashing away of black money in foreign banks.

The Income-Tax Department later imposed a notice on the accused demanding tax arrears of over Rs.50,000 crore.

The ED had earlier sought information from Switzerland on bank accounts suspected to have been opened by Ali. However, sources said the agency is yet to receive details from the Swiss authorities.

had sought tax arrears of over Rs.50,000 crore from him
title: ED conducts searches in six cities in Hasan Ali case
